page.title: 15TACKLEY PARK ESTATE
page.content: {Tackley Park Estate}was built up since 1950 when the Peak family bought Manor Farm in Tackley. During the nineteen fifties, 5 other farms were purchased giving Tackley Park Estate{1270 acres} to farm. Until 1982 there was a{dairy {herd}at Hill Court Farm but the quotas introduced by the{European Common {Market}made this a financially poor proposition. Some 500 sheep are kept with the lambing season producing some 800 lambs in a good season.{Arable {farming}fills the remaining fields:- oil seed rape for cattle food, wheat for bread making and barley being the main crops. A limited amount of hay is made. 6 full-time workers are employed and an estate manager. The smallest field is less than an acre while the largest is 80 acres. Each field is named-e.g.Pigeon's Field, Old Man Leys etc; some fields just have letters.
